nodes.bodyText:
The fact I am worried about at most is that you want to use a ThingUID without the bridge ID as third segment.
Is that a nasty bug of Paper UI when adding discovered Things having a Bridge? Or is this a more general problem of the discovery / inbox features? Do you have a clue?
Maybe is will be fixed if you add it in the bindings discovery service (see e.g. DarkSky):

  
    
      openhab-addons/bundles/org.openhab.binding.weathercompany/src/main/java/org/openhab/binding/weathercompany/internal/discovery/WeatherCompanyDiscoveryService.java
    
    
        Lines 120 to 121
      in
      666bfe5
    
    
    
    

        
          
           ThingUID localWeatherThing = new ThingUID(THING_TYPE_WEATHER_FORECAST, LOCAL); 
        

        
          
           thingDiscovered(DiscoveryResultBuilder.create(localWeatherThing).withBridge(bridgeHandler.getThing().getUID()) 
        
    
  


Change it to:
        ThingUID bridgeUID = bridgeHandler.getThing().getUID();
        ThingUID localWeatherThing = new ThingUID(THING_TYPE_WEATHER_FORECAST, bridgeUID, LOCAL);
        thingDiscovered(DiscoveryResultBuilder.create(localWeatherThing).withBridge(bridgeUID)

nodes.bodyText:
From my POV that's wrong. When creating a Thing related to a Bridge the resulting ThingUID should contain the Bridge Id.
ThingUID w/o Bridge:
<bindingId>.<thingTypeId>.<thingId>

ThingUID with Bridge:
<bindingId>.<thingTypeId>.<bridgeId>.<thingId>

My suggested change adds the Bridge Id to the ThingUID:
        ThingUID localWeatherThing = new ThingUID(THING_TYPE_WEATHER_FORECAST, bridgeUID, LOCAL);
